intro: Saussurea dschungdienensis, commonly known as the Dschungdien saffron, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and dense inflorescence of yellow-orange ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh alpine conditions. Its flowers bloom in late summer, and it is valued for its ornamental beauty and potential medicinal properties. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
